text: it's so funny when I was poet laurate
when I be when I was named poet laurate
I went down to Washington a little bit
beforehand to meet um the uh assistant
to meet the librarian of Congress and
all that and to to kind of acclimate
myself and I did ask what my duties were
the only official Duties are to uh
sponsor a reading series at the library
Congress twice a month um and to make
sure that these so that was fun to to be
able to invite poets from all over the
world actually to come to read and to
read for the
archives that was one official Duty the
other Duty was to advise the librarian
Congress the librarian of Congress and
also and this was a funny one to promote
poetry in any
way that I see fit I said what does that
mean to promote poetry and I said
well I said well what's the budget
because you're going to promote your
budget and I got a kind of a Blank Stare
so I thought okay this means that you
make it up as you go along what else
does U you know I'm an artist I can
create and I decided to just do things
um and figured they would stop me if
they didn't have enough money which
which was a probably a good way to go
about it because um they did find money
for for various things but what was
interesting it's like it's sort of like
being Miss America for poetry and that
as a as the poet laurate you have an
immediate um cache and you have some you
have status people see you you have some
kind of publicity some kind of a public
um
stage and I thought of myself as being
more like a lightning rod people would
say oh there's a poet laureate let's ask
her or let's um tell her what to do and
I got so many letters right from the
beginning from people all over this
countries telling me what I should do
and some of them were really good ideas
so and I couldn't Implement all of them
in the time I was there the two years I
was there the one thing that I found
very very helpful was uh to remember
that many people are very frightened of
poetry and as poet Lori and I had a
chance to travel around to just inject
poetry into everyday life whenever I
could and so I visited great school kids
or the Naval Academy I mean all sorts of
places where where you you thought you
know didn't know they liked poetry or
where poetry was absolutely necessary so
um each poet lauia decided kind of what
how they want to use that public Arena
and I decided to to try to
just be there in people's faces whenever
they they turned around to make poetry
something that was all around us so I
went on Sesame Street for instance and
and and uh yeah it was really fun the
other thing that happens with po the
poet lawyers ship is that when you are
when I was in Washington
there was an opportunity to inject
poetry into the
government and though the poet lawyer
does not have to write official poems
for anything there were many occasions
when I would be asked to say a few words
which is of course a kind of a
youthemism for do you have a poem but
there's always a poem you can always
find a poem for almost any human
situation so I didn't write poems for
for specific events but um I could
look and see if I had a poem which would
fit and I because I think that it's
always important it's important if
um if there's a a celebration for some
Bill being passed it's nice to have a
poem There To Remind us all of the human
element and the human effort that went
behind it so that was that was important
too
